fields.description:
Today, if we have a couple hundreds issues in the backlog, when adding an issue from the bottom, we need to drag it through all the other issues until get to the Sprint.
It would be great if we can have a different way to do that, like different rollbars for the Sprints and the Backlog.
fields.summary: Easiest way to move an issue from backlog to Current Sprint

fields.description:
As a user, when trying to view a sprint report for a team, and I need to select a sprint last month, then please provide me the information necessary for me to locate the sprint. 

Note:  We have other individuals who go in and view sprint reports and be able to view history.  However, there is no indication to the user what sprint is associated with what time period.  There are no dates, the sort appears random, and the drop down and control box not long enough to see the information. 

We are trying to put in the associated dates automatically into the name, however, there are not enough characters to adequately name the sprint with the dates. 

Consider making the control wider to view all information in full and putting the start and end dates in parenthesis after the name and have it sorted in descending order either based on start or end dates. 

In the attached, how would you know what sprint to pick if you were looking for the the ones associated with last month or last quarter?
fields.summary: Provide more information and more relevant sort to determine sprint dates

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts

Please add a keyboard shortcut for quickly entering the Estimate field on a Scrum board.

Thank you,
[Nicholas Muldoon|http://nicholasmuldoon.com/]
fields.summary: As a user I would like a keyboard shortcut to quickly jump to the Estimate field

fields.description:
In the integration with JIRA Agile, today issues can be assigned a sprint whereas sub-tasks inherit the sprint id from their parent issue and the sprint cannot be edited.

We have several developers that for better organization, may sometime decide to convert a bunch of issues to sub-tasks and assign them to an issue promoted as their parent issue.

When issues which were originally assigned to a sprint are converted to sub-tasks, some strange behaviors may ensue:
# sub-tasks whose parent issue is assigned to a sprint that get listed in a 'sprint is EMPTY' JQL search (see attached screenshot).
# sub-tasks originally assigned to Sprint#1 (when they were regular issues) whose parent issue is assigned to Sprint#2 that get listed in a  'sprint is Sprint#1' JQL search.

This problem would be less annoying if there were to be away to force edit the Sprint field and wipe it out/reset it such that it goes back to behaving as it is designed for, but there seem to be no obvious and straightforward way (I am purposely not mentioning setting the field via REST APIs which indeed I attempted but hardly scales as a process and methodology).
fields.summary: Converting an issue with non-empty Sprint field to sub-task keeps the Sprint set

fields.description:
As a product owner I want to be able to communicate the status of my project as easily as possible without spending much time explaining the charts.

I have received some feedback that the version report diagram would be faster and more intuitive to understand if the secondary y-axis was colored in the same color as the data to which it refers. The only percentage data which is displayed in the version report is the amount of unestimated issues and so the secondary axis could also be colored in red to show this relationship.
fields.summary: Use the same color for the secondary y-axis in the version report as for the data to which it refers

fields.description:
As a product owner I would like to see a rough estimation of the impact which the unestimated issues will have on the predicted date of completion in the version report.

Obviously, this will only give a very rough estimate because the assumption that the unestimated stories will have a similar complexity as the ones which have already been estimated will not always be valid. However, it's the a best guess. This rough additional projection would simplify the visualization and communication of the projected release date of the version.

Limitiations:
If the amount of unestimated issues is too high, this projection is highly unlikely to be precise. Accordingly, the projection could remain hidden until the  amount of unestimated issues has dropped below a certain threshold (e.g. 30%).
fields.summary: Extend the "predicted completion date" to include an estimation of the unestimated issues
User may browse in either the map or list view and select an appropriate restaurant for the dinning session

fields.description: I have a sprint, "FE 17", which has now completed.  If I look at the Sprint Report, it shows only one issue, LOGGLY-6064, as having been completed.  Yet when I do a search with project = loggly, status = closed, and sprint = FE 17, there are 69 issues listed (the correct number).
fields.summary: Sprint Report not listing all issues closed during sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there does not seem to be anything that limits which Sprint an issue can be added into when done via the Issue View/Create/Edit Screens (with the 'Sprint' field). This can cause confusion as it could show Sprints from boards from a different project or cause users to link the issue to the wrong Sprint due to Sprints having the same name.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature where JIRA will warn users that the issue(s) is being added into a Sprint that was created in a Board from different a project - validate this with the Board JQL too.

h3. Workaround
Since Sprint names are not unique in JIRA, try using unique Sprint names with a prefix of the Project so that it will be easier to distinguish them.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the sprints shown in the 'Sprint Field'

fields.description:
{{As a Product Owner I want to toggle the visibility of epic lozenges on the card}}

* These are currently always shown when the card is assigned to an epic
* Toggle option in menu
* Option affects both plan mode and work mode (when implemented in GHS-9451)
fields.summary: Toggle the visibility of epic lozenges on the card
Toggle the visibility of version lozenges on the card in plan mode

fields.description:
When changing the epic order priority I would like to have that reflected in the user story priority.

Currently we have backlogs that are listed by stack rank. We have backlog which shows epics. Teams have user stories that are linked to those epics and those user stories are listed in the teams backlogs.
If make a change to epic order of priority in the master backlog, we would like to have that reflected in the user story as well.
fields.summary: Reflect the Epic priority into user story priority.
Error when I try to create sample project with scrum and kanban

fields.description:
When I plan the roadmap, I know the expected date, and the team velocity. I can then guess a total backlog size I can expect to do in that timeframe.

I'd like to be able to select items (SHIFT+CLICK or CTRL+CLICK) in the JIRA Agile Planning Board, and see the total amount of story points for that selection. That makes me able to do several things;

# If I need to remove N points from a release, I can select items until I reach that number, and then drag them in a new release
# If an item is cancelled and I free up N points for a release, I can pick and choose items until I reach that number, and drag them in the current release
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want to see the total story points in a selection in the Plan Mode

fields.description:
The ability to actually plan and receive actual charts/meaningful data is gone. If we cannot pre-load a sprint prior to actually starting the sprint, then what value is the start sprint button. 

+Repro Steps+
* Create issues
* Create sprint
* drag items to sprint from backlog
* drag items out of sprint to backlog
* click start sprint
* view charts

Notice that on the report image attached that the two circled items show the issue. These items are not part of the sprint, but should be allowed to be add or removed during planning. This allows the team to come to consensus on what is being committed too prior to the sprint actually starting. 

Right now the reports and information are inaccurate. These inaccurate reports are now being shown to our management, which raises even more questions.

This *MUST* be resolved.
fields.summary: Reports for a sprint are incorrect

fields.description:
I believe that the Agile plugin is using the incorrect time zone.
I noticed it while viewing the Sprint health widget.
The current sprint is set to finish at the end of our working day, yet it said 100% complete an hour early. Editing the time to 1 hour from now seems to have it using the correct time.

Server is set to Etc/UTC, system time is correct at this.
Jira time zone is set to London, currently British summer time, UTC+1.
fields.summary: Incorrect time zone on Agile project

fields.description:
When the sprint is being closed, too many notifications are sent to the users. 
Could you add "Send Notification" checkbox into the sprit closure process? This would help to avoid unnecessary mailing.
fields.summary: Checkbox "Send Notification" when closing a sprint

fields.description:
I'm having a very difficult time trying to convert my team from AgileZen to JIRA Agile.  While I think having JIRA in the background is a great asset, the use of screen real estate for story board layout is really attrocious.  I can't see the name of the story and there's very little information available on the card (I have to click and look at the screen and possibly scroll the column on the right).  

Please take a look at the AgileZen board.  Their layout of stories on the board are very elegantly laid out and all the information I need is on the card.  While trying to reproduce all that functionality is probably not realistic (or maybe it is), you could still make an improvement laying out text and symbols for stories.

Please consider an improvement to story layout on these boards.
fields.summary: As a user, I need JIRA Agile to make better use of screen real estate

fields.description:
I am trying to use the agile board for my company (jira.continuuity.com). My browser only displays an error:

{code}
An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught SecurityError: Failed to read the 'contentDocument' property from 'HTMLIFrameElement': Blocked a frame with origin "https://jira.continuuity.com" from accessing a cross-origin frame.
Resource: https://jira.continuuity.com/s/en_US-hdv70q-418945332/854/17/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
Line: 4
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/35.0.1916.114 Safari/537.36
{code}

I am using the latest version of Chrome. I have cleared all my cookies and my entire browsing data, it does not help. Tried to log out and in again, did not help either. Tried refreshing the page, again no better. This is blocking me in my every day work as I cannot participate in my company's agile process. Please fix this asap.
fields.summary: Can't view agile board due to Uncaught SecurityError

fields.description:
When a sprint ends and issues remain, the message states the issues will be returned to the backlog
e.g.
{code}3 issues were Done.
25 incomplete issues will be returned to the top of the backlog.
5 partially complete issues will be returned to the top of the backlog.{code}

In fact they will be placed in the first planned sprint if one exists as documented at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Ending+a+Sprint
{{Any issues not completed at the end of the sprint will be moved to the next planned sprint, as they did not meet the team's definition of "Done". If you do not have a next planned sprint, they will be returned to the backlog.}}
fields.summary: Message incorrect when ending a sprint with remaining issues

fields.description:
It would be nice if we could move a time estimation from a task to a subtask or the other way around. To a subtask is most important.

This is useful because we may estimate a task to take a week and then split it up into subtasks later. If this happpens during a sprint (which sometimes happens), we currently get spikes in the sprint graphs since the changes in parent and child task cannot be done simultaneously by us.

Preventing these spikes for this kind of change is the main reason I'm requesting this, so it may be necessary to change something in the graph algorithm as well :)
fields.summary: Move estimated time to/from subtasks

fields.description:
When a system has a lot of missing rank values for issues or none at all, a foreground reIndex will trigger rankInitially for a lot of issues. This type of rank operation will rank the issue to the bottom of the ordering, which requires the bottom 2 rows to be locked before a value can be assigned. Foreground reIndex uses up to 10 threads so this will cause a lot of contention to acquire locks on those 2 bottom rows. 

The entries below are visible in the logs:
{noformat}
(...)
2014-06-06 10:52:09,857 IssueIndexer:thread-7 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] Unable to retrieve rank for field [10801] and issue [69426]
2014-06-06 10:52:09,857 IssueIndexer:thread-7 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] gh.lexorank.service.error.retrytimeout
2014-06-06 10:52:09,857 IssueIndexer:thread-7 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=69426]. Indexing max LexoRank value instead.
2014-06-06 10:52:10,748 IssueIndexer:thread-3 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] Unable to retrieve rank for field [10801] and issue [69420]
2014-06-06 10:52:10,748 IssueIndexer:thread-3 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] gh.lexorank.service.error.retrytimeout
2014-06-06 10:52:10,748 IssueIndexer:thread-3 WARN jirauser 778x220x1 10qtvrt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=69420]. Indexing max LexoRank value instead.
(...)
{noformat}

This can impact the instance by causing excessive reindexing times. For example an instance with the following stats has taken 6 hours to index and is only at 26%:

{noformat}
___ Database Statistics ____________________

     Issues                                        : 397982
     Projects                                      : 218
     Custom Fields                                 : 165
     Workflows                                     : 120
     Users                                         : 18587
     Groups                                        : 2805
     Attachments                                   : 163215
     Comments                                      : 1567415

{noformat}

We should introduce a JVM lock on the rankInitially part of the rank operation reduce this expected contention.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA to cancel the index.
# Backup the database.
# Start JIRA.
# Unlock the rank fields as per [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field].
# Rename the rank fields to something else, for example Rank (LexoRank).
# Rename the old (Obsolete) fields to their original name.
# Uninstall JIRA Agile.
# Stop JIRA.
# Roll-back the JIRA Agile version in the database with the following SQL:
{code:SQL}
UPDATE propertynumber SET propertyvalue = 42 WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version');
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '42' WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:build');
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# Install the previous version of JIRA Agile [6.3.13.1|http://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/jira-greenhopper-plugin/6.3.13.1/jira-greenhopper-plugin-6.3.13.1.jar].
# Reindex JIRA.
fields.summary: Improvement: Introduce JVM lock when ranking initially to prevent high contention during full reIndex
Need keyboard shortcut for collapsing and extending all stories in agile board

fields.description: please see screenshot
fields.summary: Swimlane gets covered halfly when scrolling to upper edge of agile board

fields.description:
I as a (role) need to (activity) so that I can (result)

I as a plan administrator need to log in and only my role can create a new catalog and adding user security to that catalog (read/add/modify/delete) so that other users can use the new catalog or organize their book inventory.

------------
Acceptance criteria:  (Product mgr) show authenticate login (success/failure), perform activity above, results displayed in xxxxx.
fields.summary: Test story

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user attempts to start or close a Sprint without having the Administer Project permission in all Projects included, a notification is displayed:
!Screen Shot 2014-06-05 at 12.46.48.png|thumbnail!

It would useful to see more detail in that message - a list of Projects that the user at hand cannot administer. Currently, the only way to learn that is to find all Issues in the Sprint in the Navigator and check the Projects one by one.
fields.summary: Display affected Projects in the Start Sprint/End Sprint permission error dialog

fields.description:
With the current version of rapid board, I can configure item count limits so that the column background gets red when the number of items exceeds the limits.

It could be very usefull to be able to configure a background color applied when the limits are not exceeded but just reached. It would be like a warning for the team that nothing more can be put (or removed) in a column.
fields.summary: AaU, I want a column in the rapid bord to take a special color when the limit of items is reached but not exceeded

fields.description:
Hello,

There is a bug in JIRA. Steps to reproduce:
1) Create issue, assign 20 story points
2) Add issue to sprint
3) Change number of story points to 10
4) Write code, resolve issue
5) Finish Sprint
6) Go to sprint reporting. The number of storypoints counted is 20, rather then 10. The update wasn't propogated everywhere through the system
fields.summary: Story point miscalculation

fields.description:
I've attached a screenshot.  In this case, I've navigated to the "Plan" page, then to the "Work" page, resized the detail view, then navigated back to the "Plan" page to show that it pops up another instance of the warning.  I can't see any way to dismiss this popup and it obscures the page.

Note that I actually estimated every item in the list to try and get rid of it, and it still never goes away as long as I'm on the "Plan" page.

This is in the current hosted version of JIRA online.
fields.summary: "Estimate Your Issues" modal popup cannot be dismissed and never closes, can open multiple times
Decouple reports and backlog from board configuration

fields.description:
The [Latest Versions of Downloadable Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/JIRA+Agile+Documentation+Directory] for Agile are outdated.
The Creation Date for the files is September 5, 2013 and its related to JIRA Agile 6.3 instead of JIRA Agile 6.4.
Is that any prediction for the PDF release for JIRA Agile 6.4.?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Post (update) Agile PDF for download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10767].
  {panel}

Epic Name (as well as Sprint) custom field seems to automatically be added to certain screens upon JIRA Agile installation or upgrade. In my case, one of the screens the field is added to turns out to be a system screen of a Service Desk project (which cannot be deleted). Since the field is only available to Epic issue type and this issue type is not used by the Service Desk project, this should be considered an unexpected behavior.

What is strange is, manually removing the field from the irrelevant screens only lasts until the next restart. When JIRA is restarted, the screens reappear in the list of screens that the field belongs to.

!epicname.png|thumbnail!

[Unlocking the field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field] doesn't seem to work around the issue. A possible workaround might be found at [GHS-9654|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9654].
fields.summary: Epic Name and Sprint fields automatically added to irrelevant screens

fields.description:
The only thing really missing on "Agile Board" for us is: 
we want to see the numbers of issues in every status in each swimlane head line in expanded AND collapsed view. So we can easily see where work is to do and where not! It is not enough to see the total numbers next to the status labels above the Agile Board!
fields.summary: Number of issues per status in each swimlane

fields.description: If a project is created with the 'Agile Simplified Workflow' there is no condition on the Done transition that requires Close issue or Resolve issue permission. This is confusing for administrators who want to restrict workflows so that only some users can close an issue.
fields.summary: Done transition on simplified workflow should require close issue permission

fields.description: It would be awesome if you can see the rank of the issues from the backlog so that you know which ticket needs more attention and priority.
fields.summary: Show the rank of the ticket on the backlog
Create a dashboard gadget for the Velocity Chart

fields.description:
As an Administrator, I want the ability to configure a listener for starting a Sprint so that I can automate workflow events and send notifications to other teams.

This is important because our workflow goes from In Backlog > Committed > In Development > Accepted. When we start a sprint, we want to automatically commit to all issues that are In Backlog.

It's also important because we want to update issues that are linked to CRM tickets so stakeholders are aware that we've begun working on their issues.

We also want to send emails to other team members to let them know we're working on linked issues. For example: the web code team just started a sprint that includes a new web service the client team needs. We want to change the priority, and notify the client Product Manager and ScrumMaster so they can be prepared for the scrum of scrums.
fields.summary: Add a listener for starting sprints

fields.description:
We're often moving issues up/down the backlog, or on a board, which in turn updates the Rank.

When this happens an "Issue updated" event gets fired, resulting in an email notification being sent.

We would like to distinguish between normal edits to an issue (e.g. changes to description, status, comments) and updates to "Rank", but as far as I can see this is not currently possible - which means that users get lots of "update" notifications that they are not interested in (and consequently often ignore the ones they should be interested in)

Similarly, changes to "Rank" appear in the Activity Stream, often obscuring useful information.

I would like to see a Jira Agile setting that says something like "Disable notifications for changes to Rank" that optionally prevents the "Issue updated" event being fired, and the activity stream being updated.
fields.summary: As a Jira User I do not want changes to "Rank" to trigger a Issue Updated events, or to appear in the activity stream

fields.description:
A user may enter the wrong value for remaining time estimate, causing an invalid value of total remaining estimate time in the burn down chart. Though the value itself can be corrected afterwards, the burn down chart history can't be corrected. Especially when a user enters a value in weeks instead of hours, a relatively large spike shows up in the chart, which renders the chart unreadable and useless for the rest of the sprint, because of 'zoomed-out' scaling.

This issue also addresses this behaviour: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8477
(Marked as resolved by giving an excuse)

An (outdated) workaround can be found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+remove+mistyped+Estimate

I don't consider manually editing the database a viable workaround. (for OnDemand users, it isn't even possible at all). Because this issue causes significant loss of functionality, and the response/excuse from Atlassion so far triggered quite some negative reactions from users, I request this to be treated as a bug which needs to be fixed.

Suggested fix: Allow administrators to somehow undo or delete changes made by users.

(Since this issue occurs in Jira Agile, I file the it under the Jira Agile project. If the root cause lies in Jira itself, please let me know how to redirect it)
fields.summary: Mistakes when setting remaining estimates cannot be corrected for the burn down chart, possibly rendering it unreadable and useless.

fields.description:
We have several projects in Jira (> 10), with different configurations. Each project has its own dedicated team with its own settings (incluiding permission). 
Usually only some people inside the team have Edit permissions (including Epics).

Issues in epic are created sometimes by the owner of the Epic, but sometimes also by other people, and ususally in different projects that epic belogns to.
But there is no way, how user (reporter) of the issue can add its issue to Epic that belongs to other team, even if both users  want to link the issues (create Epic link).

Example: 
User John is owner of epic in project A (John  has edit permission in A project)
User Will is owner of story in project B (Will has edit permission in B project)
We don't want John to have a generic edit permission in B project and vice versa.

Usual situation is, that Will finds out that his issue is relevant to John's epic, John agrees with adding the story to epic, but Jira doesn't provide any possibility how to create the epic link.

Creating of Epic links should be based on Link issue permission rather than Edit permission.
fields.summary: Adding existing Issue to existing Epic should be based on Link permission, not Edit permission
As an administrator I would like more understandable logging for logWarningUnableToRetrieveQuery

fields.description: The new Rank field (replacing Rank(Obsolete)), is showing up in searches in the format 0|######: instead of standard decimal.
fields.summary: New Rank field not showing numbers correctly

fields.description: This would allow the backlog to still be groomed by users with 'Schedule' permissions and avoid scope increases in active sprints by only letting specific roles access to add tasks to active sprints.
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I would like to restrict permissions on adding tasks to Active Sprints

fields.description:
Steps to Replicate:
* Create a Board
* When you click the *Create Issue in Epic* from project RC, the Project field will be automatically filled in with name of the project where you last created an issue.
!scrum_1.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected Behaviour:
* Since you clicked the *Create Issue in Epic* from project RC, the project name field should show the RC project be default and not the name of the project where you last created an issue.
!scrum_2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Issue in Epic should default to the same project as the epic

fields.description: I am trying to use gadget for cumulative flow chart. But i cant do it exactly where it is very important: kanban projects. The gadget need a version but i do a continuous delivery and i dont have the version concept. As workaround  i create a stub version "current" but i need to put all of my stories in this versio, wich sounds embarassing to me. The CFD works well on agile dashboard (withou versions) but not on the system dashboard and i love that feature to use jira agile as a information radiator.
fields.summary: Agile Classic cumulative flow chart with kanban
sdfsdf

fields.description: General suggestion: ability to tag someone in a comment and have that person notified via email (or first screen after logging on, etc.). I think the standard @name tagging would be great!
fields.summary: tagging

fields.description:
1. Log into JIRA and navigate to the Workflows page.
2. Create a workflow with multiple statuses that correspond to each of the three attributes of a status: "New", "In Progress", and "Done".
3. Create another status on that workflow which also corresponds to "Done".
4. Create transitions that lead from: the New status to the In Progress status, the In Progress status to the Done status, and the Done status to the Done status.
5. Hit the Create Issue button for that project and workflow to make a card.
6. Take the card across your workflow to the first Done status.
7. Click the Agile -> <Your project(s)> -> Report tab -> Burndown buttons to view the burndown chart.
8. ---> The burndown is not marked as done even though the card entered the status that is attributed to "Complete".
fields.summary: If you create a Workflow in which you set a status as "Complete", cards that enter that status will not impact the burndown chart.

fields.description:
JIRA Agile allows to group issues per epic - which is great.
The name 'epic' is for some organisations very alien.  They would like to use terms like 'project', 'feature', ...

Would it therefore be possible to support other issuetypes, such that the rapid board interprete this as epics ?
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to use other issue types as Epic, such that these issuetypes show up in the 'Epic' view
Our rapidboard doesn't have any board administrators.

fields.description:
As a manager planning what work to move from the backlog to the sprint, and also in assigning issues to individuals, I really need an at a glance view of how many hour/story points have been assigned to each user in the currently planned sprint.  As is, we are guessing or having to manually switch to view a user one at a time to see how much is assigned to them.  This does not scale.

A reasonably easy solution would be to add an expandable left panel to the view that shows all the users and the total hours/points assigned to them in the being-planned sprint.

I found a very old issue that seemed to indicate that a feature like this existed once upon a time, but I can find no mention or way to use it in the current version. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-507

Thanks!
fields.summary: Need to view hours/work assigned per user when planning a sprint

fields.description:
The brand new control chart offer the ability to zoom into the chart to do a deeper analisys on a specific time range.
It would be great to have the same feature in version report.
fields.summary: User should be able to zoom in version report

fields.description:
In a long run, more and more sprints are being displayed on the burndown chart. It would be great if we can choose which sprints we want to display so that it won't be hard for us to have a look on every sprint.

In this case, we can save time and avoid performance issue as well.
fields.summary: Limit the Sprint Visibility in Burndown Chart

fields.description:
Hello,

We are facing problems with teams not submitting last week timesheets in Tempo but continuing work on projects.

We need to force users to first Submit last week's timesheet On every Friday, else they should not get access to see their Project Plan.

We need help to have an integration between Jira Agile and Tempo.
We are ready to pay for any customization that you would need to do to get the feature implemented.

Please advice on the same.


Regards
Gauri
fields.summary: Need to restrict user access to Jira Project and Agile board if Tempo timesheet for last week is not submitted

fields.description:
Hi,
We have a Agile board which uses filter (configured for project ABC, & filter is configured using JQL query):
project = "ABC" ORDER BY Rank ASC

Now, say project ABC has been renamed to XYZ, then you can't see any issues under Agile board since board uses filter JQL query which still points to project ABC.

*Improvement/Solution looking:* On opening the Agile board, jira should verify if the configured JQL is without error, if error is their then jira should throw an error. Here we are changing the project name & then no project exists with configured JQL query, so we should get an error on opening Board. (else board will show as empty & user get confuse on losing his data).
fields.summary: Board should throw error if Advance JQL filter query is not valid

fields.description:
Problem:
-----------
Currently there is no way to view the list of stories per epic in a jira query or any view to show the epic-story hierarchy.
fig 1;
Epic x
Story 1 of Epic x
Story 2 of Epic x
Story 3 of Epic x
Story 4 of Epic x

Yes, you can do this on the rapid board by selecting the epic in the epic panel to filter the stories of that epic but it doesn't provide a custom view of the various fields you wish to compare that you get from a jira filter with selected columns.

As a Program Manager I constantly encounter this challenge as do many other functional groups such as Product Management. We find it to be an important view in initial planning of a release.

If Epic Link was sortable (GHS-10130) we'd at least be able to achieve the list of stories per Epic even if the epic wasn't shown.
fig 2;
Story 1 of Epic x
Story 2 of Epic x
Story 3 of Epic x
Story 4 of Epic x

Enhancement Request:
------------------------------
The 'epic link' value on a story is the Epic's 'epic name' field value.  
Could you please consider enhancing the Epics to have an Epic Link value automatically assigned to it based on its 'epic name' value. 
This could be non-editable or even hidden on an epic.
It would allow a jira query to return the epic and story using the epic link field.
fields.summary: Associate an 'Epic Link' value to an Epic by automatically assigning it the Epic's 'Epic Name' value to allow filtering of Epics and Stories by Epic Link

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Admin creates a new project + board via the RapidStart welcome mat
    i) Admin selects simplified workflow (the recommended option)
2) Non-admin user logs in and creates a new board referring to the project created in the first board
3) Non-admin user creates some issues under the project
4) Issues will not appear on the newly created board as the workflow doesn't match.

This sequence of events results in the following screenshots seen in the configure board screen.
!screenshot-1.png!
!screenshot-2.png!
fields.summary: When creating a new board the workflow does not respect the project's workflow

fields.description: Looks odd because of the subtle button for the epic picker making the spacing look wider.
fields.summary: OPINION: how-to link needs to spacing on the left

fields.description:
Some filters in my board are only useful in plan mode, while others are only useful in work mode.

I would like to configure in which mode which filters are visible.

Easiest way to do this is by adding two editable columns to the quick filters modification screen (see attachment)
fields.summary: As a Agile Board user, I would like to see different quick filters in plan mode and in work mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When dragging an issue into a version on the Scrum planning board, the issue is not updated and an 'Internal Server Error' is displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sample Scrum Project.
 # Add one of the issues, for example SSP-10 to version 2.
 # Archive version 2.
 # Drag that issue into version 3.

h3. Expected Results

The issue updates the version to 3, and removes the archived versions as listed in the Confirmation screenshot.
h3. Actual Results

An 'Internal Server Error' is thrown and the below errors appear in the logs:
{noformat}
2014-05-20 16:32:28,444 http-bio-60625-exec-24 ERROR admin 992x897x1 ujh0b0 127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/issue/fixversion/set [web.rapid.issue.IssueResource] Unable to complete GreenHopper REST method
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.add(AbstractCollection.java:260)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:342)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.AbstractVersionsSystemField.getUpdatedVersions(AbstractVersionsSystemField.java:491)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.AbstractVersionsSystemField.updateValue(AbstractVersionsSystemField.java:391)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateFieldValues(DefaultIssueManager.java:802)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:767)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy22.updateIssue(Unknown Source)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy22.updateIssue(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.version.VersionServiceImpl.setFixVersions(VersionServiceImpl.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource.setFixVersion(IssueResource.java:377)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource.access$1500(IssueResource.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource$6.call(IssueResource.java:286)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource$6.call(IssueResource.java:268)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:60)


{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Unarchive and unrelease the archived version(s) on that issue.
 # Release the version and move issues to another version as per the released screenshot.
 # Archive the version again.
fields.summary: Attempting to drag an issue into a version displays an Internal Server Error

fields.description:
Reproduce steps:
1- Created new issue (type- story)
2- Added many sub-tasks
3- Within issue, re-ranked items to match business priority
4- When viewing in work tab in Jira Agile, the sequence is NOT:
- the sequence displayed in the ticket
- the sequence it was entered
- any other sequence we can determine

Sprint team must open ticket to see priorities, which defeats point of board.

Found in: JIRA Agile  6.3.13.1, Jira Version: v6.2.3#6260-sha1:63ef1d6  (installed by us in AWS cloud)

I've see other tickets here, but most of them are closed from prior versions... I'm guessing this is a duplicate of another request, but couldn't find an open one to comment on.
fields.summary: Sub-task rank on Work tab doesn't mirror actual sub-task rank within issue

fields.description:
It would be useful to see the total number of actual working days next to the Sprint Start and End dates in the reports. This would be particularly handy when analysing velocity changes from Sprint to Sprint over a period of time.

At the moment, it's only possible to make the calculation manually.
fields.summary: Display total working days in Sprint in reports

fields.description: Control chart new and current give different numbers - e.g., take a look at the average on our (perfectomobile) R&D board. Why is that? What's the right value? Also, I'd like to see the standard deviation (value) on the new chart but it's not available. Will be nice if you get it added. Thanks.
fields.summary: average (and other) values in Agile Labs new control chart differ from the current control chart

fields.description: Control chart new and current give different numbers - e.g., take a look at the average on our (perfectomobile) R&D board. Why is that? What's the right value? Also, I'd like to see the standard deviation (value) on the new chart but it's not available. Will be nice if you get it added. Thanks.
fields.summary: average (and other) values in Agile Labs new control chart differ from the current control chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10720].
  {panel}

Created due to [support suggestion|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/ghs/problem-report-11881] and [bug report ticket, redirected to support|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10678]

I've been investigating problems of interaction between our plugin and JAG, which occurs to a customer, who uses JIRA 5.1. 

SYNOPSIS:
In a nutshell, the problem is the following: if there is an add-on, which has a {code}
<dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs-underscorejs</dependency>
{code} specified for context, applicable for JAG's own screens (like "... /secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=planning"), the JAG gets broken (can not render it's views, due to imported underscorejs priority over JAGs own underscorejs).
The issues root cause comes from the underscorejs version conflict (JAG expects underscorejs to be 1.4.4, but if there is plugin, imporing underscorejs from AUI, the imported underscorejs version might not be 1.4.4)\*.

For me, as for a plugin developer there are such concerns:
* If I would later on need to render my plugin's UI on a JAG's own page, I will have to either switch to my own no-conflict underscorejs (which would give an additional library to maintain), or to rely on the fact, that JAG uses underscorejs and thus do not import it (which is really a bad practice).
* (warning: becoming grouchy here) AUI and ADG encourage library reuse\*\* throughout front-end applications. If this is a strongly advised principle, why should people make workarounds in order for another vendors plugin (read "JAG") to work properly. I mean, there would be a plugin, which needs it's dependencies throughout all the contexts (even for JAG's own pages, as JAG is a great plugin somewhat a standard for Agile project tracking). Should such a plugin's vendor diverge from the concepts and recommendations?
* Any plugin with underscorejs dependency in the highlighted contexts block the JAG. I believe, that implies, that some plugin developers would stumble upon that incompatibility and would spend quite some time to dig to the issue root cause (this story might document the issue such that it would be searchable)

SCENARIO:
# run atlas-create-jira-plugin
# ensure {code}
<web-resource key="foo" name="Bar">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs-underscorejs</dependency>
        <context>atl.general</context>
        <context>atl.admin</context>
</web-resource>
{code} 
in the atlassian-plugin.xml
# ensure the plugin is able to run on JIRA 5.1
# run atlas-run against the new plugin
# install the JAG
# go to the JAG getting started page
# configure a project for Agile
# create an agile board
# open the web browser debug console
# go to that board,
 (!) (observation) see the agile board not loading !10678_01.png!
 (!) (observation) see a typeError indicating, that _.chain is not a function

SCENARIO 2 (JAG 6.3.2.2):
# run atlas-create-jira-plugin
# ensure {code}
<web-resource key="foo" name="Bar">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs-underscorejs</dependency>
        <context>atl.general</context>
        <context>atl.admin</context>
</web-resource>
{code} 
in the atlassian-plugin.xml
# ensure the plugin is able to run on JIRA 5.1
# run atlas-run against the new plugin
# install the JAG
# go to the JAG getting started page
# click "create a new board" button on the Agile panel
 (!) (observation) see a blank popup !10678_02.png!
 (!) (observation) see a typeError in the web browser firebug console indicating, that _.chain is not a function
----
\* - if one would wonder to see [the version matrix for AUI to JIRA|https://developer.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1278074] and [the version matrix for underscorejs in AUI|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/AUI/Third%20party%20libraries], one would note, that only starting from JIRA 6.2 (where JIRA uses AUI 5.3.3), the underscorejs version in the AUI would catch up the underscorejs version in JAG (although the issue with _.chain not present would not occur in JIRA starting from JIRA 6.0, which uses AUI 5.0.1, which includes [underscorejs 1.3.1|http://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://raw.github.com/jashkenas/underscore/1.3.1/index.html])
\*\* - https://developer.atlassian.com/display/AUI/Tips+for+Implementing+AUI {quote}
Do not include your own/another copy of the bundled libraries.
{quote}
fields.summary: Upgrade JIRA Agile's usage of underscore.js so that it can depend on the version supplied by JIRA/AUI

fields.description: When a board is created as part of JIRA Project creation, the only Administrator of that board is the individual admin who created it.  The Project Administrators should automatically have the ability to administer the associated board without the JIRA Admin having to take the extra steps to add them in the board configuration.  This likely relates to JRA-3156.
fields.summary: Project Admin should have admin rights on associated board

fields.description: As an user, after creating a Sprint, the Sprint Name requires a whole line on the screen. Since the Sprint Name can only have 30 characters, our request is to avoid that blank space and place the Sprint Name at the right side of the Board Name so it will be possible to use optimise the screen usage.
fields.summary: Sprint name taking up an entire line

fields.description:
Hi,

We have been using JIRA Agile / Greenhoper in Development for quite a long time and recently we have introduced JIRA Agile in some Operational Teams like Order Management and Accounting. Due to the nature of these departments and tasks, the estimation and tracking is both set up to be "time". The team estimates a task and then books hours against the task during the sprint. Goal is (amongst others) to create a fair workload balance across all agents. Tickets we talk about here have 1/2 day work as a minimum, but can easily be 20days of effort.

This all works brilliantly for us, but the Teamleaders have issues with Tasks that are estimated to take longer than one sprint (2weeks) and which are therefore carrying over to the next sprint after closure.

Issue is: The remaining estimate is not used in plan mode, but the original estimate is. This leads to the following example: 
Original estimate: 10d
Time spent: 8d

In plan mode for the new sprint this issue shows up with 10d, which makes it very hard to create a good next sprint, without checking each and every ticket  for the remaining time.
When the sprint has been started, the issue is kind of resolved, because then the remaining time is being used. But this creates the need for scope changes...

While fully understanding the approach on "original estimate", please provide an option to use "remaining estimate" in plan mode. The desired feature would be that the small dot with the original estimate in it (currently) is filled with the remaining estimate. If remaining estimate is not set, then original estimate shall be used.

This would enable us to plan fair sprints with good workload balance without having massive scope changes during the sprint. 

Thanks,
Bernd

Native Instruments GmbH
+49 30 61 10 35 - 1251
fields.summary: Remaining estimate in Plan mode
Selecting "More Actions > Add field" in the Issue Detail pane results in an error
As a user, I want to be able to see a burndown based on story points combined with remaining hours of subtasks

fields.description:
Using Jira 4.4 I am able to add parents to components by : 

1. navigating to the planning board, 
2. adjusting the view to group by components on the right hand side
3. editing the component and setting the "parent" to a parent component. 

This works perfectly, showing the child components in the planning board view perfectly, and showing them in bulleted form  in dropdowns. 

I have seen that periodically all of the components seem to lose the parent child relationship. We are not able to recreate the issue on the fly, but have seen it occur several times in the last 2 weeks. 

Are you able to advise on how to get these data to remain in place? 

Thanks,
Dave
fields.summary: Components losing parent relationship

fields.description: As a user I would like to link from the sprint 'traffic lights' to the issues in the Issue Navigator so I can analyse them better.
fields.summary: Link from the sprint 'traffic lights' to the issues in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
As reported in Feedback (linked issue)

It looks like the announcement banner is causing a problem where the bottom of the board is 'missing' and cannot be scrolled to.
fields.summary: Can't scroll to the bottom of agile board

fields.description: The release burndown chart does not show any bars other than the original estimate when work is done prior to the first sprint.
fields.summary: Release burndown: not showing all sprints

fields.description:
Since JIRA Agile 6.0.4, the boards will automatically poll for changes to the board every 30 seconds as long as the browser is in focus. Any new changes will then be reflected on the board. 
Reference: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5568

The polling period should be a configurable value (or disabled entirely), as it helps customers maintain control over the performance of their instance. (preventing large boards from polling to help reduce load on the server)
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to configure the interval in which JIRA Agile polls for board changes

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If an issue is not completed in one sprint, and then it's inserted into another sprint and then its completed, the sprint field will gather both sprint values. This is great for historical data purposes inside Jira itself, but when exporting the issue to an Excel file, this can be misleading for reports as we won't be able to verify which sprint actually resolved the issue.

h3. Expected behaviour

In an excel export, we would like to see only the sprint value of the sprint that actually completed the issue, and not all of sprints which the sprint has been in.
fields.summary: As an user I would like the "Sprint" field on Excel export to contain only the last sprint value of the issue

fields.description: In JIRA Agile when creating an issue, the Epic Link and Sprint fields contain values for all projects. Is it possible to limit this to only show Epics and Sprints for a selected list of Projects?
fields.summary: Improve or limit suggestions to a set of projects when linking issues to Epics

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA Agile I have completed a sprint. I now clone an issue from this completed sprint.

I'm now unable to remove the cloned issue from the completed sprint.

GHS-9786 seems to be relevant to this. However it continued into a support issue. But yet knowledge on confluence or on answers.atlassian.com is missing about this.

How the heck do we do this?
fields.summary: Allow issue to be removed from completed sprint

fields.description:
In addition to "flag" an issue it would be great to set a custom card background color.
It would be much more recognizable.

Maybe make an editable list of colors to choose from on the boards configuration page, with some hint texts with the meaning of the color displayed on hover on the board or something like that.
fields.summary: Allow coloring Cards on Boards

fields.description:
Create a gadget of the version report that allows a user to select a project/version - this is similar to the greenhopper agile gadget. 
Gadget should allow a user the ability to choose the legend options to display. 
This would be a great step towards replacing what is provided with Classic Boards

The other item would be provide the option (if it doesn't already exist) to show this based on hours instead of story points.
fields.summary: Create Version Report Gadget

fields.description:
We have multiple agile teams using Jira agile and we've been using it for a little over 2 years now. The view has greatly improved since GreenHopper days, but we have some a few significant issues that cause our team to have to work around Jira that I wanted to raise to you:

1. Accounting for both hours and story points is challenging: Our team estimates our sprint and measures our sprint success by velocity and story points, but we use hours as a gut check during our planning to understand capacity this is a challenge for many reasons:
- If we have hours enabled our burndown chart only burns down by hours we aren't tracking, not story points which we want. We need to have hours enabled in order to do detailed level tasking. This makes our burndown chart useless for us
- On the plan view, when we select an individual on the team to see how their hours line up we can only see the tickets where they are assigned to the parent level ticket. This doesn't work for us as we have multiple team members assigned to subtasks on each ticket it, so we have to keep track on each person's hours on a separate spreadsheet during planning.

Summary of team info on the "Work" view
- Some of our teams are moving back to physical scrum boards during their standups because the "work" view is too busy as it's impossible to see what's in a sprint without scrolling down and we want to see if all on one screen.
- There really isn't a good way to view stories & subtasks. We use the swimlane option of having parent stories across the view with the subtasks showing, the parent tickets always seem to get lost in that view. The ability to customize the work view more would be appreciated. We want to be able to easily toggle between sprint summary view and a detailed level view

Accounting for Story Point Changes & Velocity Calculations
- If you add / change story points to a story after a sprint has started or add a story with points to a sprint after it's started than the numbers aren't on the sprint report. This is really annoying as I have to click on each ticket that doesn't have a story point listed and do my own manual calculations.
- Also, I have a whole separate spreadsheet for each sprint team that breaks down the the team's historical performance. This is how we determine the "average velocity per person on the team per day" and we used this to estimate the velocity during planning based on the team's availability. Having that as part of reporting would be awesome!
fields.summary: Jira Agile Board View Summary / Role up view

fields.description:
Work added is sometimes being duplicated in the release burndown chart.

This occurs when:

- there are duplicate "added to version" events in an issue's change history (this can occur when multiple fix versions are being assigned to an issue).
- an issue is transitioned to "done", then "not done", before being added to a version
fields.summary: Release burndown: Incorrect counting of work added

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I would like to be able to define what statuses are used to determine the 3 blocks on the Sprint Health Gadget using custom JQL.

Currently the gadget uses the first column for blue, last for green and all others for yellow.

I would like to be able to select each block, and use JQL to choose which of the status labels gets grouped in each of the blocks. See diagram for how I would like to group my labels.
fields.summary: Ability to define the JQL used to determine each block of the Sprint Health Gadget

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA Agile, I would like my sub-tasks to inherit their parent issue's Epic Link (similar to how they inherit the sprint field) so that I can use epics as filters. 

For example, currently, if I use the swimlane configuration to sort my Agile Board by Epic, the sub-tasks all appear in a swimlane by themselves at the bottom, called "Issues without epics."
fields.summary: Associate sub-tasks with their parent's epic

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* have an issue be part of a sprint that is completed
* clone the issue

expected: cloned issue is only part of active sprints
actual: cloned issue is part of completed sprints as well
fields.summary: Do not include completed sprints when cloning issues

fields.description: All charts for all project tested are currently failing to display. Screenshot attached. Please help! We use these heavily for project management!!
fields.summary: Our on-demand account is failing to display JIRA Agile charts

fields.description:
As a agile team member I want to have the status of an issue regarding (for instance) INVEST criteria visualized on the scrum board's planning page in order to quickly see which issues are ready for being included into the next sprint.

In detail:
Our company has chosen to visualize the result of checking an issue for INVEST criteria by using the *traffic light plugin* ("de.polscheit.jira.plugins.traffic-light_status"). After a team member has checked all criteria and found them acceptable, the traffic light is switched to green, signalling the issue is ready for sprint. This works well in the normal issue detail view but
- neither can the traffic light be visualized directly in the list of issues to be ranked and placed into the spring in sprint planning mode
- nor can the traffic light field be added to the issue detail view shown right of this list if an issue is clicked. It is simply not in the list of available fields, even if I configure it as "global" (all projects, all issue types).

I am aware that we could, in principle use a plain text field or yet another issue status to hold the same information, but a traffic light visualizes the "sprint readiness" much better imho.
fields.summary: Allow custom rendered fields to be displayed on sprint planning board

fields.description:
The JIRA Filter gadget embedded on our wiki pages is throwing the following type of error:

Error rendering macro 'gadget' : Error rendering gadget [ https://interasset.jira.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml ]

When searching the gadget library, the JIRA Filter gadget no longer appears to be available.

What is the alternative gadget to use to embed a JIRA Filter/Issues List onto a wiki page?
fields.summary: JIRA Filter gadget not working and no longer available

fields.description:
I want to export the issues in the same order that they appear on the Agile plan.
I would like to export all issues broken down by sprint and assignee, SORTED by the ORDER I set up in the Agile PLAN.
It is a critical feature to share planning with people who prefers to see the plan on a spreadsheet.

I communicated with tech support and they wrote that it is not currently possible and that I should create a feature request.
fields.summary: Export agile plan to a spreadsheet

fields.description:
I regularly use the classic agile gadget on dashboards to evaluate the overall progress of large projects.  We typically avoid story points and instead look at solely at remaining hours (hours tab).  So we're looking at the classic agile gadget for a 12-18 month period.  When I look at the red line, it's automatically set to start with the amount of work remaining in hours on the start date set in the gadget's configuration and then is rendered in a straight line where 0 is at the end date as set in the configuration.  

This is nice for uses where the number of hours on the start date is equivalent to the capacity of your team given some velocity (I run a model for long projects that assumes N developers at M%utilization thereby giving me a capacity in terms of how much available scope measured in time that the team can handle at any date in the project); however, in reality our backlogs are never quite built so perfectly, so what I'd like to do is have the ability to add another line to the burndown gadget that represents the capacity of the team.  This would be in addition to the current red line.

I would want to specify the following information:

1. Start date
2. Capacity on start date measured in hours
3. End date
4. Remaining amount of work left on end date.  It would probably be ok to set this to 0 and I could probably make do with not being able to configure this value.

Then the software would render a line based on that information.  This would allow me to see how I've modeled effort and then as I'm monitoring the team's progress, the goal would be to make sure my green line stays near this model line.  It would also make it very clear if I had room in my model to add scope or if I had to start thinking about cutting scope.

Additionally it'd be nice to allow hiding of the currently implemented red line.

One additional problem that the current implementation of the red line in the gadget imposes is that you search for a date in time where the amount of work in the backlog approximates the team's capacity that you are trying to model and you are then not able to see anything prior to this.

I know this may not be how folks intended the tool to be used in terms of long projects with burndown charts spanning many months, but the tool does a great job for this type of project except for the issue mentioned here.

I'm running jira 6.0.8 and have been unable to find anything in the docs for future versions that suggest this is possible.
fields.summary: Create a custom line with a user-specified particular slope to reflect a custom user-defined capacity model (custom version of the red line)

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

I successfully imported the epic's. Now it was time for the stories.

When i use the csv importer I can't select the field epic link when importing stories. I can select the fields Epic Name, Epic Status and Epic Time. 
In our test environment I can select the above fields + epic link + epic colour.

How can i solve this problem?

Friendly Regards,

Total Company
fields.summary: Can't select epic link when importing stories with the CSV importer.

fields.description: I’m having trouble getting to the Sprint 1 reports for my team.  Attached is the image of the sprint report and error message as well as one of the stories closed in the sprint.   You can see that the story was updated within the sprint and that the sprint shows that it ended on 4/17/14.  The error is:  "Error, no issues in sprint to generate scope change model".   I look at the issues individually and things look right on the story but yet I can’t get to any of my sprint reports as this Error is preventing me from seeing them.
fields.summary: Sprint reports are failing after closing a sprint

fields.description: When editing an issue or setting an Epic Link it still shows Epics that were marked as done/completed. See screenshot (e.g. Simpleepay surveys should not show up)
fields.summary: Epic Link Drop Down in Issue Detail View still shows Epics marked as Done

fields.description:
I have setup an Agile Board in which I have user stories. Each user story has sub-tasks. I am facing a problem with estimation. I want to estimate my stories in Story Points and Sub-Tasks in hours/days etc.

How do I estimate my Stories in Story Points. Suppose if a Story is estimated to be 3 Story Points and I enter just 3 in the Original Estimate, it doesn't get displayed in the plan view if I select Story Points from the Estimation Option in the Board Configuration. If I selection Original Estimate, it shows 3m.

In the Plan View, I am not seeing my estimates for Story Points which is a serious concern for me and I can't plan my stories.

What do I do?
fields.summary: Storypoints and Sub-tasks not summing up

fields.description: It would be great if we can have an option to not consider non-working days in the Cumulative Flow Diagram, like we have in other reports.
fields.summary: Option to hide non-working days from Cumulative Flow Diagram

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Open an issue
 * Cmd-click "View on Board"

Expected behaviour:
 * Displays the issue in a new tab with the dialog visible, *or*
 * Does nothing

Actual behaviour: 
* Displays the issue inside a dialog
fields.summary: Cmd-click on "View on Board" displays issue within a dialog

fields.description:
* As a PO I would like to utilize the new Burn down report, so that I can measure our progress for a release. 

----

# The  new Version Burndown report does not retro actively account for work previously completed. 
# Per the 'Learning More' topic on the new Version report
#* 'Issue completed in a sprint, but only added to the version afterwards:
The issue will be shown on the report, as if it was always part of the version.'
fields.summary: New Burn Down Report is not retroactively reporting on Sprints

fields.description:
Error trying to search issues in Opened Sprint

Search:

project = Anastasia and Sprint in openSprints()
fields.summary: Error trying to search for issues in Opened Sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10652].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to edit an issue presents with the error "Issue has multiple acive or future sprints" [sic]. This prevents saving the changes to the issue.

The following may appear in the _atlassian-greenhopper.log_:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2015-12-03 11:08:20,373 http-bio-8080-exec-1099 ERROR lgodbole 668x100203x7 1ou4znq 10.0.0.3,127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/issue/details.json [web.rapid.issue.IssueResource] Unable to complete GreenHopper REST method 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Issue ABC-123 has multiple active or future sprints
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintIssueServiceImpl$SprintFilterFunction.apply(SprintIssueServiceImpl.java:381)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintIssueServiceImpl$SprintFilterFunction.apply(SprintIssueServiceImpl.java:364)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.ServiceOutcomes.map(ServiceOutcomes.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintIssueServiceImpl.getActiveOrFutureSprintForIssue(SprintIssueServiceImpl.java:235)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource$1.call(IssueResource.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource$1.call(IssueResource.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.issue.IssueResource.getPageData(IssueResource.java:105)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2080.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with a problematic data set (one that has managed to get multiple Sprint fields onto one edit screen in different tabs).
# Edit the issue and change the sprint field.
# Attempt to save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

The changes are successfully sent.

h3. Actual Results

The changes fail to save and the attached error is presented to the user.

h3. Notes

This is caused by multiple Sprint fields appearing on the edit screen in different tabs. This appears to be caused by an upgrade task. Additionally in earlier versions the spelling of "acive" was incorrect, and has since been updated to "active".

h3. Workaround

Edit the screen for that project and remove the Sprint field from one of the tabs as per [Defining a Screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-Editingascreen'sdetails]. This will prevent JIRA Agile from displaying this error.
fields.summary: Cannot edit Sprint field due to Issue having multiple active or future sprints
Ability to bulk edit using sprint name rather than sprint ID
